description: Rear infill side return extension at a lower ground floor level and a mansard roof extension and alterations to ground floor rear.
decision_conditions:
<p>All new external materials in respect of all the works hereby approved (and any other
incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the existing building in
respect of materials used, detailed execution, and finished appearance.
</p><p>REASON: In the interests of visual amenity.<br></p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 10pt 0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">Prior to occupation of the development hereby approved, detailed specifications and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage system</span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; white-space: pre-wrap;"> (i.e. water butt, rain garden, bio-retention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150 mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving, etc.) shall be submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the LLFA. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration.</span></p><p><span id="docs-internal-guid-e7c7cce8-7fff-fd88-970c-40cb5e06793e"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">REASON: </span><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;color:#000000;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">To protect and where possible enhance biodiversity leading to a net gain.</span></p>

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
